name: autorotation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the turning of the blades of a helicopter (= an aircraft with spinning blades on top that can take off and land vertically) without using power from the engine, or a single spin of these blades: As a helicopter flight instructor, she was well practiced in performing autorotations in the event of engine failure. Autorotation works much in the way of a parachute, with air pressure creating lift on the rotor as the aircraft descends.
More examplesFewer examplesIf a helicopter's engine power fails, the pilot can attempt a landing using autorotation, which resembles a maple seed pod spinning to the ground.
